availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Morgan (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier - Pvt. 13th Ky. Inf.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Jeanetta Noe Morgan in Green County, Kentucky, on November 19, 1848. Father of Jesse S. Morgan, William W. Morgan, and Malinda Morgan. Laborer in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861 to April 14, 1862. Died from wounds received at the Battle of Shiloh, Hardin County, Tennessee, on April 14, 1862.
